meanings.definition: Responding to gravity by growing in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The geotropic roots of the plant grew downwards towards the soil.
meanings.sent2: The geotropic nature of the vine made it climb towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The geotropic flowers seemed to bow respectfully towards the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her geotropic instincts always guided her towards the path of least resistance.
meanings.sent5: The geotropic behavior of the tree made it stand tall and strong against the pull of gravity.
